title: ARAM needs a bit of balancing/modification
body:
Now I know what you're thinking, "Your champions are randomly picked, don't complain!".

But.

Have you ever played a game in ARAM when it's, I don't know... say 42/9, and your on the losing side? Yes? No? Sometimes your faced with the prospect that it seems absolutely hopeless to try and fight, or run, because you simply cannot attack them. If you run, you inevitably die.

First, the problem I wish to bring to attention is that ARAM has a few champions, namely Sona, Lux and Xerath, when picked, wreck ABSOLUTE havoc in game, be they behind or ahead. I wish that certain champions will receive a shed of modification so that they don't completely melt your ass in 3 seconds flat, 5 minutes into the game.

Second, if one team is ahead in ARAM, it is certainly very difficult if not impossible for the losing team to have a fighting chance. This more or less corresponds to the point above.

Third, this is a simple method to address all the problems stated above, minus the feeling of complete loss and annihilation and to some short-tempered and toxic players, rage. Adjust the surrender timer from 20 minutes to around 10 minutes to allow the opposition to surrender the game more quickly because dying over and over and over and over again doesn't really help the team's morale.


Also I know that this argument is not a particularly strong or stable one and that there may be certain details that are exaggerated or wrong in some way, but I wish for you to at least see the problem here.
